Package com.sclable.domain

Class DomainConstraints

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sclable.domain.DomainConstraints
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDomainObject, DomainModel
    public abstract class DomainConstraints
extends Object
    This class provides methods to ensure domain constraints are fulfilled.

    Examples:

    Throws a DomainException if propertyValue is null. By default a DomainException with DomainException.DomainError.DOMAIN_CONSTRAINTS_VIOLATED is thrown. AddtionalErrors will be populated with one constraint-specific ERR per failed validation. 

    
 ensure(
   constraint("propertyName", propertyValue, notBlank())
 )
    Validate does not throw immediately and can be chained with raise to throw a custom error 
    
 validate(
   constraint("propertyName", propertyValue, notBlank())
 ).raise(ERR.MY_BUSINESS_METHOD_SPECIFIC_ERROR)

        public DomainConstraints()

    • Method Detail

      • ensure

        @SafeVarargs
protected final void ensure​(Function<String,​Optional<DomainException.DomainError>>... constraints)
        Domain constraint composition method that throws a DomainException if at least one constraint is violated. A DomainException with DomainException.ERR.DOMAIN_CONSTRAINTS_VIOLATED is thrown.
        Parameters:
        constraints - ConstraintValidations.constraint(String, Object, Function) methods that return a optional ERR on validation error.
        Throws:
        DomainException - with DomainException.DomainError.DOMAIN_CONSTRAINTS_VIOLATED as error. addtionalErrors list will be populated with one constraint-specific ERR per failed validation.

      • validate

        @SafeVarargs
protected final DomainConstraints validate​(Function<String,​Optional<DomainException.DomainError>>... constraints)
        Validate performs validation checks on the passed constraint methods. If a constraint is violated, the returned DomainException.DomainError is added to constraintViolations.
        Parameters:
        constraints - functions containing validation rules that return an ERR on failure. The easiest way is use ConstraintValidations.constraint(String, Object, Function) to create a validation function.
        Returns:
        self to be chainable with raise().

      • isValid

        @SafeVarargs
protected final boolean isValid​(Function<String,​Optional<DomainException.DomainError>>... constraints)
        Check if constraints are fulfilled or not.
        Parameters:
        constraints - ConstraintValidations.constraint(String, Object, Function) methods that return a optional ERR on validation error.
        Returns:
        true if all constraints are valid otherwise false.

      • raise

        public final void raise()
        Throw a DomainException with DomainException.DomainError.DOMAIN_CONSTRAINTS_VIOLATED as error.
        Throws:
        DomainException - with DomainException.DomainError.DOMAIN_CONSTRAINTS_VIOLATED as error.

      • raise

        public final void raise​(DomainException.ERR rootCause)
        Throw a DomainException with the passed root cause as error if constraintViolations contains errors.
        Parameters:
        rootCause - error to throw
        Throws:
        DomainException - with DomainException.DomainError.DOMAIN_CONSTRAINTS_VIOLATED as error. addtionalErrors list will be populated with one constraint-specific ERR per failed validation in constraintViolations.
